title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 July 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit

11:44 <Denis2> has quit  
12:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <Slashman> has quit  
13:01 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
13:03 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <Enygma`> vmassol: "XCONTRIB-237: Add support for autocompleting nested method calls" did you mean "chained methods" instead?  
13:34 <vmassol> indeed, thanks, fixing  
13:34 <Enygma`> I was a bit confused :)  
13:34 <vmassol> yeah sorry  
13:34 <vmassol> :)  
13:35 <vmassol> Enygma`: one thing painful  
13:35 <vmassol> is this issue:  
13:35 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCONTRIB-228  
13:38 <Enygma`> yes, that`s because the velocity highlighting mode does not provide indentation support.  
13:39 <Enygma`> I`ll see if I can extend it with basic stuff like this usecase  
13:39 <vmassol> ok, cool FYI I'll do a demo in about 40 minutes  
13:39 <vmassol> :)  
13:39 <Enygma`> anything else that you have spotted?  
13:40 <Enygma`> which is very annoying?  
13:40 <vmassol> nope, that's the main one  
13:40 <vmassol> (for the demo)  
13:40 <Enygma`> ok  
13:40 <Enygma`> I`ll try to fix it  
13:40 <vmassol> thanks!  
13:40 <Enygma`> for me the most annoying one is nested macros :)  
13:40 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:41 <vmassol> yeah, I won't show that one  
13:41 <vmassol> just commented on the issue  
13:41 <Enygma`> since if you look at a more advanced page like SolrSearch, you can see the limitation  
13:41 <vmassol> yes  
13:41 <Enygma`> as a demo, you could use the screenshot I`ve added with all the supported languages  
13:41 <vmassol> OTOH  html macro is bad and usage should be limited ;)  
13:41 <vmassol> yep  
13:41 <Enygma`> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Syntax+Highlighting+Application/contentEditorHighlightedLanguages.png  
13:41 <evalica> has quit  
13:42 <Enygma`> I am now adding support for velocity in the skins object  
13:42 <Enygma`> since it was missing  
13:42 <vmassol> ok cool  
13:42 <Enygma`> but I am trinking of adding autocomplete for it as well...  
13:42 <vmassol> Enygma`: do you have the content you used in the screenshot?  
13:43 <Enygma`> wonder if I pass syntax/1.0 if our autocompletion for velocity will work  
13:43 <vmassol> for the 3rd image on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Syntax+Highlighting+Application  
13:43 <vmassol> it'll work in bridge mode...  
13:43 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <vmassol> ie the bridged 1.0 syntax  
13:43 <vmassol> which is not perfect  
13:43 <Enygma`> http://pastebin.com/6n8VgHEu  
13:43 <vmassol> thanks  
13:44 <Enygma`> let me try it out  
13:44 <vmassol> Enygma`: does js autocompletion work?  
13:45 <Enygma`> basically yes  
13:45 <vmassol> so in a JSX it'll work?  
13:45 <Enygma`> but it has its flaws (distribution provided implementation)  
13:45 <Enygma`> yes, JSX and skin editor  
13:45 <vmassol> ok  
13:45 <Enygma`> skin object I mean  
13:45 <Enygma`> but the completions are about 80% full  
13:46 <Enygma`> it sees local stuff and windows stuff,etc, but some variables defined as properties in a class are not seen  
13:46 <Enygma`> at least that`s what I remember  
13:46 <Enygma`> anyway, it's good enough for now  
13:47 <vmassol> yep  
13:54 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <Enygma`> niice, it's working. (velocity completion in skin objects)  
13:57 <evalica> has quit  
13:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

15:08 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <mflorea> has quit  
15:18 <vmassol> has quit  
15:31 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <Enygma`> vmassol: how did it go?  
15:50 <vmassol> Enygma`: very well! :)  
15:50 <vmassol> you got a lot of applauses :)  
15:51 <Enygma`> (I still did not manage to finish the indentation stuff)  
15:51 <Enygma`> :)  
15:51 <vmassol> no worries, it's not meant to be perfect for the demo anyway  
15:51 <Enygma`> now that we have it on e.x.o, maybe people will test it more  
15:51 <vmassol> but would be nice to fix for 2.1  
15:51 <Enygma`> specially the autocomplete  
15:52 <gdelhumeau> congratulations  
15:52 <gdelhumeau> it's a very good work  
15:52 <gdelhumeau> and it will be impressive for our dev customers  
15:52 <msmeria> has quit  
15:53 <Enygma`> thanks :)  
15:53 <gdelhumeau> it makes XWiki better looks as a dev platform  
15:53 <Enygma`> too bad nobody tested in in the 2 years that it already existed :)  
15:53 <Enygma`> lucky we have these hackatons :P  
15:54 <vmassol> :)  
16:02 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:03 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:13 <vmassol> has quit  
16:17 <camil7> to me it seems the ActivitySteam is two hours off in todays events; e.g. at  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Activity  
16:18 <camil7> Vincent added a page at 10:43, and that is now "3 hours ago" for me .... is that just my browser messing up the timezones ?
